channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5007] Unable to install camel-websocket and camel-cometd feature
item.description:
Affected features:

  • features:install camel-websocket
  • features:install camel-cometd

Error executing command: Can not resolve feature:
 
Unsatisfied requirement(s):
 
---------------------------
 
   package:(&(package=org.eclipse.jetty.server.ssl)(version>=8.0.0)(!(version>=10.0.0)))
 
      camel-websocket
 
   package:(&(package=org.eclipse.jetty.http.ssl)(version>=8.0.0)(!(version>=10.0.0)))
 
      camel-websocket
 
   package:(&(package=org.eclipse.jetty.websocket)(version>=8.0.0)(!(version>=10.0.0)))
 
      camel-websocket
item.summary: Unable to install camel-websocket and camel-cometd feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Link to ENTESB-4947 - same root cause 

JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:install camel-cometd
 
Error executing command: Can not resolve feature:
 
Unsatisfied requirement(s):
 
---------------------------
 
   package:(&(package=org.eclipse.jetty.server.ssl)(version>=8.0.0)(!(version>=10.0.0)))
 
      camel-cometd

I also converted this issue to sub task of ENTESB-4921 to keep features:install issues grouped together.

This might block also SSL configuration of Jetty/Hawtio websonsole https://access.redhat.com/documentation/en-US/Red_Hat_JBoss_Fuse/6.2.1/html/Security_Guide/WebConsole.html
Getting class not found when jetty is configured according to SSL docs
$FUSE_HOME/etc/jetty.xml

<Call name="addConnector">
 
     <Arg>
 
         <!-- The SslSelectChannelConnector class uses the Java NIO SslEngine -->
 
         <New class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.ssl.SslSelectChannelConnector">
 
             <Arg>
 
                 <New class="org.eclipse.jetty.http.ssl.SslContextFactory">


15:35:49,528 | WARN  | pool-6-thread-1  | XmlConfiguration                 | 98 - org.eclipse.jetty.util - 9.2.14.v20151106 | Config error at <Call name="addConnector"><Arg>n  |              n  |              <New class="org.eclipse.jetty.server.ssl.SslSelectChannelConnector"><Arg>n  |                      <New class="org.eclipse.jetty.http.ssl.SslContextFactory"><Set name="ExcludeProtocols">n  |                              <Array type="java.lang.String"><Item>SSLv3</Item></Array>n  |                          </Set><Set name="keyStore">/home/jludvice/apps/fuse/broker.ks</Set><Set name="keyStorePassword">awesomeKeyPass</Set><Set name="keyManagerPassword">awesomeStorePass</Set></New>n  |                  </Arg><Set name="port">8183</Set><Set name="maxIdleTime">30000</Set></New>n  |          </Arg></Call>
 
15:35:49,529 | ERROR | pool-6-thread-1  | JettyServerImpl                  | 119 - org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-jetty - 4.2.4 | Exception while starting Jetty
 
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)[:1.8.0_72]
 
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)[:1.8.0_72]
 
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)[:1.8.0_72]
 
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)[:1.8.0_72]
 
	at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.JettyServerImpl.start(JettyServerImpl.java:151)[119:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-jetty:4.2.4]

	at org.ops4j.pax.web.service.jetty.internal.ServerControllerImpl.start(ServerControllerImpl.java:71)[119:org.ops4j.pax.web.pax-web-jetty:4.2.4]

	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1556)

	at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl$BundleClassLoader.loadClass(BundleWiringImpl.java:1993)
 
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:357)[:1.8.0_72]

Verified in fuse 6.3 build 67 - both feature install fine. 

JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:install camel-websocket camel-cometd
 
 
 
JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:info camel-websocket
 
Description of camel-websocket 2.17.0.redhat-630067 feature
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
 
Feature has no configuration
 
Feature has no configuration files
 
Feature depends on:
 
  jetty 0.0.0
 
  camel-core 2.17.0.redhat-630067
 
Feature contains followed bundles:
 
 mvn:org.apache.geronimo.specs/geronimo-servlet_3.0_spec/1.0 start-level=50
 
 mvn:org.apache.camel/camel-websocket/2.17.0.redhat-630067 start-level=50
 
Feature has no conditionals.

But I'm reopening this issue with minor priority to fix description of camel-cometd - I guess it no longer requires jetty 8 

JBossFuse:karaf@root> features:info camel-cometd
 
Description of camel-cometd 2.17.0.redhat-630067 feature
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
 
camel-cometd currently requires jetty 8
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
 
Feature has no configuration
 
Feature has no configuration files
 
Feature depends on:
 
  jetty 0.0.0
 
  camel-core 2.17.0.redhat-630067
 
Feature contains followed bundles:
 
 mvn:org.cometd.java/cometd-java-server/3.0.9 start-level=50
 
 mvn:javax.servlet/javax.servlet-api/3.1.0 start-level=50
 
 mvn:org.cometd.java/cometd-java-server/3.0.9 start-level=50
 
 mvn:org.cometd.java/bayeux-api/3.0.9 start-level=50
 
 mvn:org.cometd.java/cometd-java-common/3.0.9 start-level=50
 
 mvn:org.apache.camel/camel-cometd/2.17.0.redhat-630067 start-level=50
 
Feature has no conditionals.
I'll wait for next build and close issue once features:install test passes, thanks

Behaviour of websocket component changed. If properties minThreads, maxThreads are null and method getThreadPool() returns also null than method createServer returns null.

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractConnector.<init>(AbstractConnector.java:170)
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.AbstractNetworkConnector.<init>(AbstractNetworkConnector.java:44)
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.ServerConnector.<init>(ServerConnector.java:227)
 
	at org.eclipse.jetty.server.ServerConnector.<init>(ServerConnector.java:96)
 
	at org.apache.camel.component.websocket.WebsocketComponent.connect(WebsocketComponent.java:146)

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/camel/commit/8aa39d2047aa2bda9da2a41e3eb15247edd193d3#diff-6909a29f433a9c32440e4b80ac06bf74L357

I had to use the following workaround to make our tests work:

<bean id="websocket" class="org.apache.camel.component.websocket.WebsocketComponent">
 
   <property name="maxThreads" value="10"/>
 
</bean>

It should be fixed...

Features

  • features:install camel-websocket
  • features:install camel-cometd

installed fine even on solaris 11 for fuse 6.3 build 69.

Closing issue.
